intro: Symphyllia mallotiformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved symphyllia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and narrow, leathery leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Its flowers are usually white or pink and attract various pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
